title: Tensor constructor passed numpy ndarray does not check type.
body_html:
>>> torch.Tensor(numpy.ndarray(shape=(2,2),dtype="int8"))

 0.6229  0.0000
 0.0000  0.0000
[torch.FloatTensor of size 2x2]

>>> torch.from_numpy(numpy.ndarray(shape=(2,2),dtype="int8"))
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: can't convert a given np.ndarray to a tensor - it has an invalid type. The only supported types are: double, float, int64, int32, and uint8.

According to @colesbury, however, it does look like ndarray passed into Tensor is doing the correct codepath.

CC @aszlam

body:
```
>>> torch.Tensor(numpy.ndarray(shape=(2,2),dtype="int8"))

 0.6229  0.0000
 0.0000  0.0000
[torch.FloatTensor of size 2x2]

>>> torch.from_numpy(numpy.ndarray(shape=(2,2),dtype="int8"))
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: can't convert a given np.ndarray to a tensor - it has an invalid type. The only supported types are: double, float, int64, int32, and uint8.
```

According to @colesbury, however, it does look like ndarray passed into Tensor is doing the correct codepath.

CC @aszlam
